subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
msgSnippet: Yeah, but if your able subscribe and post to the mailing list you can also read the web site. That should give you all the info you need - specific questions
messageBody:
Yeah, but if your able subscribe and post to the mailing list you can also
read the web site. That should give you all the info you need - specific
questions could be answered rather than "how do I use junit" which is
covered quite well on the site..

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andoni O'Conchubhair [mailto:andoni.oconchubhair@...]
> Sent: 21 December 2001 11:58
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
>
>
> No need for that. You have to have the manual first before
> you can read it.
>
> Also the Junit manual is so buggy he's better off asking for help.
>
> Andoni.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Heath, Joseph [mailto:HeathJ@...]
> Sent: 21 December 2001 11:55
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
>
> Sure!
> Why dont you send me the code and I'll write all your tests for you..
>
> ..no forget that..
> just tell me where and when the exam is and I'll just take it for you!
>
> RTFM!
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: forjava2001 [mailto:forjava2001@...]
> > Sent: 21 December 2001 10:20
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] how do i start using Junit
> >
> >
> > can any one help me out.
> > ia'm going for a java exam and i need to test my code which
> i decided
> > i'll do using JUNIT.
> > can anyone help me out in that.
> >
> > sid
> >
